Class MesosEventClient.ClientStatusResponse

    public static class MesosEventClient.ClientStatusResponse

    • Method Detail

      • reserving

        public static MesosEventClient.ClientStatusResponse reserving()
        Tells the caller that this client is deploying the service. This may either be an initial deployment or a redeployment following a configuration change, either of which may involve growing the service footprint. This does NOT include cases of relaunching failed tasks. This code has two purposes:
        • Allow upstream to detect a stalled deployment (cluster too small, or other misconfiguration)
        • Allow a multi-service scheduler to only have one service deploying at a time, to prevent deadlocks if the cluster doesn't have enough free room for multiple simultaneous services

      • running

        public static MesosEventClient.ClientStatusResponse running()
        Tells the caller that this client is running the service following a completed deployment. This is the typical state for healthy services. It is also used for services that are in the process of uninstalling.

      • finished

        public static MesosEventClient.ClientStatusResponse finished()
        Tells the caller that this client has finished running and can be switched to uninstall mode. The caller should long-decline any unused offers.

      • uninstalled

        public static MesosEventClient.ClientStatusResponse uninstalled()
        Tells the caller that this client has finished uninstalling and can be shut down. After this is returned, the caller may then notify the client of framework deregistration by calling MesosEventClient.unregistered(), but this is not required.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object o)
        Overrides:
